dialogues.text: They are the "healthy ill". They don't actually have anything yet - they may never. But since few of the pre-conditions can be cured or reversed, it is easier to treat them as if they were already sick. As they enter a car, driven by GERMAN, Jerome spies a bea young GIRL, 11, sitting on the steps of the housing proje staring forlornly into space. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By means of a donor I have cheated the system for the last four years to open doors that would otherwise be closed to me. Jerome wheels Eugene into the palatial condominium comple the two men now reside. INT. GATTACA. PRESENT DAY. We return to JEROME's reflection in the glass. Other GAT EMPLOYEES are gradually gathering behind him. JEROME (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the guise of Jerome Morror I have risen quickly through the ranks of Gattaca. Only one of the Mission Directors has ever come close to discovering my true identity. We now see what Jerome has been gazing at through the win the whole time - the sight that has brought a hush to the complex. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange to think, he may have more success exposing me in death than he did in life. Jerome wipes his eye and also goes to investigate. We fo an extreme close up of his EYELASH. Loosened by Jerome's it breaks free and floats gently down to the floor where comes to rest. INT. GATTACA AEROSPACE CORPORATION. MORNING. DETECTIVE HUGO, late-forties, wearing a crime-scene hygen and gloves and a full clear mask - looking more like a su or a toxic waste worker than a detective - places a blood spattered computer keyboard alongside the Director's shat skull. Once each work space has been vacuume transparent plastic vacuum bag is detached, sealed and la OTHER DETECTIVES video the scene with camcorders. Video spit out of the cameras for instant inspection. EXT. GATTACA - LANDSCAPED GARDENS. DAY. A silicon police tape cordons off the crime scene. From landscaped garden, a crowd of GATTACA EMPLOYEES view the proceedings through the glass walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the Director's body)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, awful it didn't happen sooner. Nervous smirks from nearby employees. We focus on JEROME Standing slightly apart from the others, he does not appe share the joke, or perhaps even hear it. Jerome watches, eyed, as a DETECTIVE approaches his work station with a m vac. A chill goes through Jerome as the detective's clea passes over his desk. Jerome is distracted by a smear on the window, obstructin view. DIRECTOR JOSEF suddenly appears at Jerome's should Standing a pace behind the Director, computer notepad in is IRENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky to be getting out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still going ahead as planned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The launch window is only open until week's end.  Tragic though this event may be, it hasn't stopped the planets turning. He glances towards a group of Detectives headed by HUGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to excuse me, Jerome.  I have to meet with the authorities--naturally, we're co-operating in any way, although I won't tolerate a major disruption. (as he departs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was going with you, Jerome. As the pair depart, Jerome and Irene exchange a glance. is also aware of Jerome's unease. INT.  GATTACA - CORRIDOR.  DAY. We focus on JEROME's eyelash, still lying on the floor. A huge crescent-shaped hair that fills the screen.  Sudde there is a roar of a mini-vac and the eyelash is sucked u follow the eyelash's journey, down the throat of the clea into the specimen bag where it is sucked against the bag' clear, plastic wall. The blood and other body matter from t murder scene is sucked up by a portable wet-vac and the s bag appropriately labeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chime sounds over the P.A. follwed by an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your co-operation.  Please return to your work stations immediately. The PROGRAMMERS get to their feet en masse and begin fili the work room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, no counselling? INT.  GATTACA COMPUTER COMPLEX - DIRECTOR'S OFFICE.  DAY. He carefully places two of Eugene's ha the comb and scatters another bag of fraudulent matter ar his work station. INT.  GATTACA - SIMULATOR ROOM.  DAY. In a large, bare room a simulator does a slow dance back forth on its hydralic legs, miming the path of the space craft Jerome will soon be aboard.  The simulation ends an JEROME exits the simulator through a small door.  IRENE hesitantly approaches, carrying a slim electronic tablet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Jerome.  I'm sorry to bother you. Jerome turns, not displeased by the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to her notepad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked to compile a log for the investigators--they want to know everyone's whereabouts last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night?  I was at home. Irene makes a note with her stylus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can that be, er, verified?  Were you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it can't be verified.  Yes I was alone. Irene makes another note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks bad, doesn't it, Irene? What about you? Where were you last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we don't know for sure about you, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary, wondering where the conversation is headed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we say we were together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have better things to do this week than answer the foolish questions of some flatfoot. Don't you? Irene contemplates the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently pressing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shall we say we spent the evening together? Irene is still unsure whether or not Jerome is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be convincing, Jerome, I would have to know what that was like. Irene turns and departs.  Jerome watches her go. INT.  EUGENE'S CONDOMINIUM.  NIGHT. The paraplegic EUGENE, seated by the window, meticulously a long fingernail into numerous clippings.  He places the clippings in small plastic bags and seals them.  He then to fill tiny sachets with blood.  He turns as he hears JE enter down the spiral staircase with the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't forget the truffles? JEROME places the items in the refrigerator in the bathro retrieves a bottle of vodka - the vodka incongruous-looki beside the blood and urine specimens.  Joining Eugene at workbench, he pours them both a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something amiss, trying to keep his humor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mission Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misinterpreting the deadpan remark)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found him in his office this morning-- beaten so bad they had to check his nametag. Eugene takes in the news, a smile broadening across his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an act of benevolence--a service to the community.  So that's it.  Now there's nothing between you and ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was still warm when they confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused by Jerome's attitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This calls for a celebration.  Doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is crawling with Hoovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?  You didn't kill him, did you? Jerome shoots him a glance for the inappropriate remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how much of you can be there?  Even if the "J. Edgars" do find something, in a week-- (glancing up to the night sky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you'll be slightly out of their jurisdiction. (gently chiding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we've got to get drunk immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still tempering Eugene's enthusiasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to earn your supper.  I've got my final physical tomorrow. Jerome wheels Eugene's chair to a specially constructed p that allows the wheels to spin in mid-air.  Jerome tapes electrode to Eugene's chest and attaches the wire to a sl recording device.  Eugene begins to spin the wheel of the faster and faster.  Jerome monitors Eugene's steady heart through a set of headphones. INT.  GATTACA AEROSPACE CORPORATION - COMPUTER COMPLEX. The complex is virtually empty - only a handful of the hu of PROGRAMMERS working late into the night.  IRENE approa JEROME's work station on the pretext of delivering some documents.  Trying to act casually, she looks under the p on his desk, then opens the top desk drawer. We see an EXTREME CLOSE UP of the comb lying there - the hairs trapped between the teeth of the comb.  Irene remov of the follicles and drops it into an envelope she is car INT.  24-HOUR SEQUENCING LAB.  NIGHT. "SEQUENCING-WHILE-U-WAIT".  Similar to a 1-hour photo lab store - little more than a booth - displays a price list wall.  "FULL SEQUENCE - $80".  IRENE waits in line with a section of other CUSTOMERS.  She checks the contents of t envelope that contains the hair. The YOUNG WOMAN in line ahead of her allows the TECHNICIA take a swab from her full lips with a Q-tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mustering patience, referring to the Q-tip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The specimen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kissed him five minutes ago.  A real good one. Overhearing, several PEOPLE in the line snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long-suffering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. The technician hands the swab to an ASSISTANT.  The Young is handed a number and takes a seat.  Irene hands her env over the counter.  She too is handed a number.  We follow Jerome's follicle as another TECHNICIAN places it in an analyzing machine. INT/EXT.  SEQUENCING LAB / PARKING LOT.  NIGHT. The TECHNICIAN returns the envelope to IRENE along with a miniature compact disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remarking on the profile result)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9.4...very nice. Jerome's counterfeit genetic profile appea the screen.  The details confirm her worst fears. EXT.  MICHAEL'S DINNER CLUB.  NIGHT. Familiar with the car, he goes immed to the trunk to retrieve Eugene's collapsible wheelchair. Jerome tips the valet - a credit card wiped through a dev INT.  MICHAEL'S DINNER CLUB.  NIGHT. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, gentlemen.  Your table is ready. (referring to Jerome's mission)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long now, sir.  You'll be upstairs before you know it.  We're going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as much as I'll miss your Stroganoff. I'd like to take one of your chefs with me. INT.  MICHAEL'S DINNER CLUB.  NIGHT. He fails to notice minute FLAKE OF SKIN dislodged from his chin.  We follow flake as it comes to rest beneath the table. LATER, Eugene and Jerome watch COUPLES dancing a samba on dance floor.  A WAITER vacuums the table with a discreet, handheld miniature vacuum while a WAITRESS clears the pla She accidentally drops a knife onto Eugene's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast at the sight of his lifeless legs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.  Did I hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, a trace of bitterness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, if you'd hurt me, I'd be cured. Eugene, the worse for drink, gropes for the waitress's le she easily avoids his clumsy pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to meet a real-life spaceman? Jerome, always aware, scanning the club, suddenly spies NAPOLEON, his Gattaca colleague, on the other side of the room.  Napoleon is taking a hit from a vial concealed in hand.  Jerome abruptly turns his back to avoid being reco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking back his drink, misinterpreting the hasty departure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, there's more atmosphere where you're going. INT/EXT.  CAR.  NIGHT. Driving along the freeway, Jerome's car suddenly dives do escape road.  EUGENE looks sideways at JEROME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive. INT/EXT.  CAR.  NIGHT. The car careens around and around a small circular buildi a cloud of dust billowing up behind the car. The hard turn is repeated with increasing recklessness, E fighting to control the bucking car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming in both fear and exhilaration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta stop!!  I gotta stop!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going!!  Keep going!! Finally the car spins to a halt in a cloud of dust.  When dust settles it is revealed that they have been circling base of a huge satellite dish in a desolate location. EXT.  SATELLITE DISH.  NIGHT. JEROME relieves himself against the building at the base of the satellite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently chiding Jerome over the joyride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot.  You could ruin everything with a stunt like that. Eugene spies a spacecraft launching from Gattaca city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gazing up into the night sky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least up there your piss will be worth something. (smiling at the thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll all be showering in it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (zipping his fly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And drinking it.  It's like Evian by the time it's filtered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the rocket ship)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that one? Jerome doesn't bother to look in the direction of the cra merely glances to his watch. He joins Eugene on the hood car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11.15 to the port.  A maintenance crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you stay up there before you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A day or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe they're sending you to the Belt--you of all people--never meant to be born, on a mission to discover the origin of life. Eugene laughs to himself and passes the bottle to Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be going instead of me. Jerome taps Eugene's lifeless legs with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there they wouldn't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing heavenwards, shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm scared of heights. INT.  CRIME LABORATORY - AUTOPSY ROOM.  NIGHT. dialogues.text: (to the tongue, as he inserts the tip of the swab into an analyzer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The computer gradually builds a portrait of th of the tongue using genetic predictors.  The Investigator wanders over to the window as his Assistant reads the information from the screen.

dialogues.text: Blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interest piqued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blind? (mildly amused, checking the monitor for himself)

dialogues.text: The tongue is blind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.text: Who cuts out the tongue of a blind man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically referring to the pool of vomit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Did you want it? Jerome meets Eugene's gaze.  There is a trace of bitterne in Eugene's drunken smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get it for you. Eugene bends down to scoop up some vomit with his hand bu elevator arrives and Jerome quickly wheels him away.  Eug head flops to the side as he passes out. After removing Eugene's soiled cl he heaves the tall man from the chair and onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (maudlin, sobbing like a child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attempting to comfort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I wasn't drunk--I knew what I was doing when I walked in front of that car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --What car?--Go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I walked right in front of it.  I was never more sober in my life. Jerome looks at Eugene's lifeless legs, trying to cover h shock at the revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jerome by the collar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, Vincent. Eugene's head falls back onto the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be drunk to call me Vincent. But Eugene does not reply, drifting into sleep once again Jerome pulls a blanket over him. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you were dragged out here, Sir.  It's hardly worth wasting your time--a no-nothing case like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently rebuking his subordinate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's dead, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Sir.  We're checking the entry log, alibis, grudges...

dialogues.text: Grudges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out over the balcony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look around, I see a lot of dry eyes. The Director was not... (searching for the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...universally loved.  He was leading the cut-backs in the program.  You're looking at a room full of motives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head adamantly, referring to the bag in his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not so convinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With respect, Sir--it may be the only unaccountable specimen but the profile suggests--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if this Vincent Luca is alive, is it likely he could bludgeon a man to death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not likely. The Investigator's tone suggests that the identity of the culprit is no longer a matter for debate. There is an aw pause before the Detective falls into step with his super

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you're thinking along the lines of a robbery gone sour--a thief disturbed in the act? The Investigator merely shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course that doesn't jibe with what we found.  This was an angry killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to the profile in Hugo's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows with these "deficients"?  His profile indicates a proclivity for violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to appear co-operative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll run a crossover on the eyelash for any family or associate connections--

Easily negotiating the on-co cars, she emerges safely on the other side of the highway JEROME, rounding the car from the passenger side, is abou follow, when he suddenly pulls up sharply at the curb.  W on his eyes, deprived of the benefit of their contact len From Jerome's POV, we see that the headlights rushing tow him are nothing but a series of fast-moving blurs - blurs merge together.  He is unable to distinguish between the vehicles or judge their distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back urgently from the other side, mindful of the light beginning to leak into the sky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  We'll miss it! Irene stares expectantly back at Jerome with her 20/20 vi unaware of his predicament.  Jerome puts a foot off the c the wrong moment and is almost collected by an on-coming Irene is taken-aback at his mistiming.  Does she detect a on Jerome's face?  To Jerome, the figure of Irene on the side of the highway is merely a featureless shape but he her expectation.  He touches the spectacles, still in his pocket, but they are an unthinkable option. He shakes the idea from his head and turns back to the sw flowing highway.  He makes up his mind - he cannot allow to be shamed, even at the risk of life and limb.  Hardly glancing at the traffic, he suddenly bolts blindly across road.  Headlights hurtling towards him, cars fortuitously brushing past his heels, horns blaring.  Jerome makes a f leap to the haven of the far curb, the rush of air from a fast-moving truck blowing him the final inches to the sid Irene is stunned by the near miss.  She is about to comme Jerome takes her by the arm and ushers her towards the du

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  We'll miss it. EXT.  BEACH.  DAWN. JEROME and IRENE huddle beneath an overcoat as the sun cr the horizon, staining the sky with an ochre blush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? Jerome nods.  However, to his eyes the rising yolk is not but an out-of-focus, abstract ink blot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envy you, Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  The only trip I'll make in space is around the sun-- (letting a handful of sand slip through her fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --on this satellite right here. Irene turns to Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting out what's really on her mind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Listen, I don't want to waste your time and I really don't want you to waste mine. I don't know what you're after but I have a feeling I'm not it. Irene suddenly takes Jerome's hand and puts it up her sweater, onto her breast. Although taken aback, Jerome m no effort to withdraw his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying his unease)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here.  My heart. (adding quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm careful--weekly check-ups.  I'm on a drug maintenance program, blood thinners, diet-- (slowly removing his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know what you'd be getting yourself into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.  I'll start experiencing symptoms in my late-fifties. (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But unless they come up with something between now and then, I won't live much past 67. Jerome's mouth drops a little, betraying his surprise at statement from a woman plainly still in her twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I think about it every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not quite recovered from his surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. INT.  POOL.  MORNING. The INVESTIGATOR swims his race with the unseen opponent. Investigator's ASSISTANT, carrying a phone, tries to attr attention. EXT.  JEROME'S POOL.  MORNING. JEROME sits at his own poolside in his robe, feet danglin the edge, smoking a cigarette.  EUGENE, from his wheelcha applying bleach to Jerome's hair and eyebrows with gloved hands. At the same time, Jerome plays a sleight-of-hand game wit syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complicated.  I couldn't stop her apologizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a catch. No doubt she's worried that she would lower the standard of your offspring. Everybody wants to "breed up". (idly curious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be blasГ€)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how it is with these altered births --somebody told her she's not going to live forever and she's been preparing to die ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking of telling her, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.  But she's have to know eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have to know. She doesn't want The camera travels down Jerome's scarred legs to find tha pool is completely drained. We now realize that it never contained water. A BARREN WASTELAND. A desolate landscape, resembling the surface of the plane We pull back to find that we are peering at this forbiddi desert through a circular aperture. INT. CRIME LAB. DAY. The INVESTIGATOR lifts his head from the eyepiece of an electron microscope through which he has been examining a fragment of skin - the skin is identified as belonging to YEAR-OLD VINCENT. DETECTIVE HUGO stands at the Investiga side - his attitude more respectful in light of the disco Detective Hugo points out a location on a computer-genera map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chagrined)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skin flake was found in Michael's Restaurant. The employees are all accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A customer?  Does this Michael's cater to misfits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shifting the view of the map to include the Gattaca complex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But one or two "borrowed ladders" have shown up there in the past. The Investigator understands the significance.  They wand to a blow-up photograph of the 20-YEAR-OLD VINCENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to consider the possibility that he's playing somebody else's hand. A smile gradually broadens across the Investigator's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a perverse pleasure in the slowly dawning revelation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  He's a "de-gene-erate". (glancing to a photo of the Gattaca crime scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works at Gattaca.  Why else would we find the eyelash near the washroom?  Nobody stops to take a leak during a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly covering himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still possible the eyelash specimen came from a janitor, delivery man--it could have blown in through an open window. The Investigator appears not to be listening, his mind ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind racing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was afraid of being exposed.  That's why he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is hard to believe he could be one of their elite workers.  You've seen their security system.  They know who works there. (referring to 20-year-old Vincent's profile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if you ignore the man's expiration date, his profile suggests that he doesn't have the mathematical propensity let alone the stamina to pass their physicals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate these imposters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical, referring to a file of Gattaca employee ID photos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the ID photos match the enhancement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man can change his face--but blood is forever. Sample every employee within the parameters I gave you. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intravenous. Hugo's mouth drops open at the mention of "intravenous".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately protesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know their workforce.  Two-thirds at least fall into the category.  We'll be closing down their operation for days. (seeking a compromise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least go with a fingertip sample or urine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood.  From the vein. The Investigator turns on his heel to prevent further pro The Detective and his ASSISTANTS exchange looks of exaspe behind the Investigator's back. INT.  GATTACA.  DAY. JEROME, drinking water, stands in front of a large video bulletin board.  Among other things, it displays the elec mugshot of 20-YEAR-OLD VINCENT alongside the recent compu generated age enhancement of his face. Some distance away, CAESAR, the elderly janitor, discusse mugshots with a YOUNGER JANITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look like anybody to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly sonofabitch though, isn't he? Jerome half-smiles, realizing that the conversation is fo benefit.  Having made it clear that they do not intend to their former colleague, the two janitors continue their r Jerome crushes his paper cup.  Forgetting himself, he drops the cup into the wastebasket. INT.  CRAFT.  DAY. JEROME familiarizes himself with the interior of a spacec under the supervision of DIRECTOR JOSEF and the MISSION COMMANDER.  The screen that Jerome sits at is identical t one he operates in the computer complex - displaying aste 951 Gaspra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Somewhere in the dust of Gaspra is the key. (warming to his theme)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the beginning of the book--the life we became.  With the original building blocks who knows how far we can take "the godding".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even someone as advanced as Jerome will be last year's model by the time we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't get your hopes up, Commander. Irene enters the craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr Morrow.  The investigators have begun their testing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so inconvenient, Irene.  They can make an exception for Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize, Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not yor fault, Director. (afterthought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your predecessor were still around we may not be going to Gaspra at all. That's what I would call inconvenient. Jerome exits the craft with Irene. INT. GATTACA CORPORATION - CORRIDOR. DAY. A line of MALE GATTACA EMPLOYEES snakes out the door and the corridor. The INVESTIGATOR walks slowly down the lin trying to eyeball his suspect. Concentrating on the shor dark-haired men in the line, he looks straight past JEROM However, as the Investigator ignores him and walks by, we haunted look in Jerome's eyes. INT. GATTACA - TESTING LAB. DAY. Every available TECHNICIAN is working to accommodate the of the thousand or so PROGRAMMERS. Twelve testing statio operate simultaneously. A HOMICIDE DETECTIVE supervises station. JEROME reaches the head of the line. He notes exiting COLLEAGUE holding a cotton ball to his arm. A NURSE directs Jerome to LAMAR's testing station. Lamar deposits the previous patient's labeled vial into a blood carousel under the watchful eye of a large DETECTIVE, cle not relishing his assignment. Jerome rolls up his sleeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the table lined with syringes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the plungers, Lamar?  What are you doing, opening a blood bank? The syringes are clearly not Lamar's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gentlemen of law enforcement are concerned that my testing methods may have been compromised. Lamar inserts a fresh syringe into Jerome's arm.  As Lama the blood, Jerome suddenly flinches and flexes his arm violently, causing the needle to bend and buckle, exiting skin from a second puncture point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!! Having pulled away from Lamar's grasp, Jerome withdraws t needle himself, blood still squirting from his vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing a nearby wad of gauze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus--I'm sorry, Jerome. The large Homicide Detective winces and turns away from t arcing spray, a splash of blood spattering his shoes.  In midst of the commotion, with his practised sleight-of-han Jerome removes the vial from the syringe and replaces it another concealed vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfazed, putting Lamar at his ease)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be out of practise, Lamar. Lamar hurriedly takes the syringe from Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining and removing the switched vial from the bent syringe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got enough here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the squimish detective, as he holds the gauze to his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any more, you can always get it off his shoes. The Detective notices the spatter of blood across his bro and, with a look of disdain, wipes it clean. He tosses t incriminating tissue down a hygenically sealed garbage sh Lamar places Jerome's labelled vial in the carousel where immediately analyzed by the computer. Jerome's "legitima Employee ID code appears on the screen - "VALID". EMPLOYEE enters the testing lab. INT. GATTACA. DAY. JEROME exits the testing lab with the gauze held to his a IRENE is standing outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you didn't do it after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking darkly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess somebody beat me to it. INT.  GATTACA - MEZZANINE FLOOR.  LATER IN THE DAY. From above, the INVESTIGATOR and HUGO observe the final E exit the testing lab. LAMAR, following the employee out of the lab, throws a lo vindication to the two cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing his patience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.  It's a blind alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resolute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we've missed something.  We Hoover again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have the manpower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it.  From outside, if you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what budget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angered by Hugo's excuses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it out of your damn pension if you question my authority one more time! The INVESTIGATOR turns his back on his subordinate and id contemplates the nearby telescope. Hugo resignedly relay news to Director Josef who is standing some distance away Josef's immediate reaction is to march towards the Invest Hugo trailing behind. DIRECTOR JOSEF collects himself as notices the Investigator's hand on the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to look--in the telescope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still referring to the telescope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One look through there and you would know why I can't possibly allow you to disrupt operations any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so unconcerned that you have a killer in your midst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, your presence is creating more of a threat. I don't think you have any concept of what we do here--how meticulous our preparations must be. We are about to send twelve people through 140 million miles of blackness to rendezvous with an object the size of a house and the color of coal. So it's rather critical to point them in the right direction. And we certainly don't need you looking over our shoulders. Besides, I don't believe there is any evidence that the killer is amongst us. I don't see too many other dead bodies littering the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveying the mostly empty facility)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but since there aren't too many live ones tonight either, you won't mind us conducting one further sweep. If he does not work here, then there should be no other trace of him. (to Hugo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better get some people out of bed, Detective. (a thought occurs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime we can re-check his favorite haunt. Director Josef quietly seethes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josef, referring to the telescope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Director, I prefer my microscope. INT.  EUGENE'S CONDOMINIUM.  DAY. JEROME readies himself for an evening out - a bandage aro arm from the needle puncture.  EUGENE wheels himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly guilty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I've got plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to his bandage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already got her doubts.  I have to act like nothing's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you'll be very convincing. Jerome ignores the remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's. Eugene looks at him askance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody goes there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous, glancing around the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may as well invite her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afterthought as he picks up his jacket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about your little pin cushion. To be honest, I'm looking forward to having the place to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing through the bravado)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll still be able to talk when I'm away. The conversation will just keep getting longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time I'm at the Belt, you phone and say, "How are you?"  Forty-five minutes later I reply, "Not bad.  How are you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'd better have something important to say if it takes that long to get an answer. INT.  MICHAEL'S CLUB.  NIGHT. IRENE and JEROME step off the dance floor of the smoky, d dinner club and take a seat at their table.  Irene is ago the strange assortment of PATRONS, the cigars, the laden trolleys.  It is all slightly off from the pristine world accustomed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry smile, enjoying her fascination)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never been here? (a dessert trolley is wheeled up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me order for you. Jerome selects a chocolate torte from the trolley.  Jerom savors a spoonful.  Irene is tempted but then remembers h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better not. She reaches for her elegant pill box.  Jerome takes anoth spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sure of what you can't do.  Do you even know what it tastes like, Irene? Irene goes to deny it but cannot. MICHAEL suddenly approaches the table with a WAITER in to Irene is about to steal a taste of the dessert with her f when their plates and glasses are whisked away and the ta immediately hoovered.  Michael whispers in Jerome's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the side door. Jerome looks up in time to see DETECTIVE HUGO coming thro front entrance with several other DETECTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his colleagues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check for lenses, hairpieces-- A Detective shines a flashlight in the eyes of a MALE PAT A SECOND DETECTIVE tugs the hair of a SECOND PATRON.  Jer takes Irene by the hand and escorts her out of the side e Several other COUPLES make for the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attempting to explain the hasty exit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those checks take forever. EXT.  MICHAEL'S CLUB - SIDE ALLEY.  NIGHT. Spilling out of the exit, JEROME and IRENE find a burly plain clothes DETECTIVE barring their way.  Before the De can say a word, Jerome has wrapped his fist in his jacket and smashed him in the face.  He continues to beat the De until he lies motionless on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerome! Spying other Detectives some distance away in the parking Jerome leads Irene out of a hidden side gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her by the hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his bruised knuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not safe.  I shouldn't have brought you here. Jerome drags Irene across a vast, desolate lot, lit only moonlight.  Feeling exposed, he breaks into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My medication.  I left it back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get it later. (forcing her to look him in the eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene, please. Irene realizes his seriousness.  She begins to run with h The clearing is wider than Jerome anticipated.  They are halfway across - extremely vulnerable if the Detective th look in their direction. INT.  MICHAEL'S.  NIGHT. The INVESTIGATOR is grilling MICHAEL, the club's owner. investigator suspiciously regards the multitude of mini-v the kitchen and the incinerator burning the refuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an accusing tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run a clean establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a health inspector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing Vincent's mugshot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you recognize this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eyes aren't so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet. Hugo calls out from the side door where he has discovered his fallen colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. The Investigator hurries to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the still dazed Detective, examining his injuries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he hit you with his fist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (head in his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reprimanding the beaten Detective)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch your face.  Don't swallow. Don't spit. (to Hugo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, clean his teeth. Hugo uses a flashlight and a small dental-like implement to pick skin from Jerome's knuckles from between the Dete teeth.  The Investigator finds the hidden side door. EXT.  DESOLATE LOT.  NIGHT. JEROME and IRENE continue to sprint across the enormous v lot in the moonlight, splashing through deposits of mud a water.  Just as the gate opens in the distance, Jerome hu Irene into the safety of the undergrowth on the other sid Irene, out of breath, desperately feels for her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset, a strangled protest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to kill me?  Are you?! Don't you understand, I can't do that! Jerome tenderly removes Irene's hand from her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just did. Irene looks back across the vast clearing they have just negotiated, realizing what she has just done. From across the other side of the clearing comes an echoi cry from the center FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent!  Vincent! EXT.  MICHAEL'S.  NIGHT. The INVESTIGATOR is about to cry out Vincent's name once when he realizes DETECTIVE HUGO and the other DETECTIVES watching him, askance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hugo, covering his frustration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll vacuum these streets if we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing the Investigator Irene's pill box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught them trying to flush these, Sir. The Investigator carefully examines the heart pills. EXT.  IRENE'S APARTMENT.  NIGHT. JEROME walks IRENE to the steps of her apartment.  Jerome about departing but Irene takes him gently by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sure of what you can't do. Jerome follows her inside. INT.  IRENE'S BEDROOM.  NIGHT. JEROME and IRENE climb a staircase to her bedroom.  Witho another word they begin to make love. LATER THAT NIGHT, JEROME cannot sleep.  He rises quietly not to disturb IRENE.  He silently opens the double-windo the upstairs bedroom.  He carefully gathers his pillow fr bed and shakes it out of the window. Slowly Jerome turns to gaze at the wood floor.  In the mo we see an EXTREME CLOSE UP of a single hair lying on the floorboards.  Jerome bends and picks up the hair, trying identify it in the dim light.  On his hands and knees he to clean the floor with a towel.  Irene turns over in the bed.  Jerome freezes but she continues to sleep.  He real may be spreading even more of his skin and hair over the Overcome with frustration and the enormity of his task, h begins to quietly weep. EXT.  A FIELD.  DAWN. dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unduly agitated)

dialogues.text: (picking up a phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you like to be yourself for the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The INVESTIGATOR looks to IRENE in the rear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taunting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know who he is, do you, Irene? He hands her the pill box found in Michael's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you have problems? INT.  EUGENE'S CONDO/JEROME'S CONDO.  DAY. Having wheeled his chair out of sight, EUGENE eases himse of his wheelchair and onto the floor. dialogues.text: (through intercom, no trace of his distress)

dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.text: (a moment's hesitation)

dialogues.text: Jerome--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you're feeling better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're here. Who are your "friends"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about the Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning boredom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Investigator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't we do this another time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: No?  What's keeping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm a slow learner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. (looking up through the small window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, while you're up there, maybe you could tidy the place up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. The two men embrace, Caesar breaking off before Jerome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't go getting everybody lost out there. You'll give us a bad name.  You won't have me to keep an eye on you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to Caesar's locker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy to oblige)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbingly calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to the Investigator's badge)

dialogues.text: Maybe it's you who's forgotten. (meeting his gaze)

dialogues.text: I could ask you the same question. (glancing to the impressive complex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost sound like you believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the remark, extending his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me now, Vincent.  You've gone as far as you can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (refusing Anton's hand, glancing to the telescope above them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a few million miles to go yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: It's for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (increasingly angered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, even you want to tell me what I can't In case you hadn't noticed, Anton, I don't need rescuing. But you did, once. Anton is clearly stung by the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goading)

dialogues.text: Well?  You have all the answers.  How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resolute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't beat me that day. I beat myself.

dialogues.text: Who are you trying to convince?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the incinerator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we get rid of the traces of him although we never truly succeeded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconcerned)

dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic smile)
